title: Stable and Clean Iron Power from ICONIC
descriptions:
Abstract:

The "Stable and Clean Iron Power from ICONIC" project represents a groundbreaking initiative aimed at developing a sustainable and efficient Iron Power technology as a CO2-free circular energy carrier. This innovation addresses the critical need for stable and environmentally friendly energy storage and transport solutions in the face of increasing global energy demands and the imperative to reduce carbon emissions.

Iron Power technology boasts numerous advantages, including high energy density, ease of handling, safety, and low cost. However, it currently faces significant challenges such as flame stabilisation, the evaporation of iron leading to nano-particle generation, and high NOx emissions. The ICONIC solution—Ignition COntrolled low-Nox Iron Combustion—proposes a novel combustion concept to overcome these issues. By recirculating partly-cooled hot burnt gases, creating autoignition mixtures, and suppressing nano-particle and NOx formation, ICONIC aims to achieve a well-controllable burner system.

The proposal outlines a strategic development plan that includes the creation of a small-scale system, followed by the conceptual design of a Mega-Watt size burner. This phased approach ensures meticulous attention to detail and gradual scaling. The anticipated outcomes include a patent-pending ICONIC burner and a comprehensive market evaluation to explore commercial interest from startups and potential launching customers.

The proposed project not only promises a significant reduction in NOx emissions but also the potential for industrial-scale implementation of a circular energy carrier system. The successful proof of concept (PoC) will serve as a critical indicator of the project's viability and its capacity to revolutionize the energy market. Through participation in the ERC MetalFuel program, this initiative aspires to set a new standard for sustainable energy practices, paving the way for a cleaner and more stable energy future.

Abstract:

The "Stable and Clean Iron Power from ICONIC" project aims to revolutionize the way we store and transport sustainable energy by utilizing Iron Power technology. With the dual challenges of climate change and the growing demand for energy, there is a pressing need for CO2-free and circular energy carriers. Iron Power presents an innovative solution with its high energy density, ease of handling, safety, environmental friendliness, and cost-effectiveness.

Despite its potential, current Iron Power systems face technical hurdles such as flame stabilization, nano-particle evaporation, and high NOx emissions. The ICONIC (Ignition COntrolled low-Nox Iron Combustion) project proposes a novel combustion concept to overcome these issues. The approach involves recirculating partly-cooled hot burnt gases to create an autoignition mixture that stabilizes the flame and suppresses the formation of nano-particles and NOx emissions. The project entails developing a well-controllable ICONIC burner, starting with a small-scale system and progressing to a conceptual design of a Mega-Watt size system.

The process involves burning an iron aerosol mixture, collecting iron-oxide powder, and regenerating the iron powder using green hydrogen. This circular process ensures that the system remains CO2-free throughout its lifecycle. The project has already attracted commercial interest, with start-ups and potential launching customers closely monitoring its progress. The development phases are set to culminate in industrial-scale system implementation and a thorough market evaluation.

With a patent pending for the ICONIC combustion concept, the project's success will be measured by the Proof of Concept (PoC) success. The grant proposal seeks funding to support the development of ICONIC under the ERC MetalFuel program. The anticipated outcome is a sustainable and scalable Iron Power system that can meet the growing global energy demands without contributing to greenhouse gas emissions.

Abstract:

The "Stable and Clean Iron Power from ICONIC" project aims to revolutionize the energy sector by introducing Iron Power as a sustainable, CO2-free circular energy carrier. This innovative technology leverages the high energy density of iron and is characterized by its ease of handling, safety, environmental friendliness, and cost-effectiveness. The ICONIC (Ignition COntrolled low-Nox Iron Combustion) combustion concept is designed to overcome current challenges such as flame stabilisation, iron evaporation, and high NOx emissions which are prevalent in existing systems.

The project's approach includes the recirculation of partly-cooled hot burnt gases to enable mixture autoignition. This, in combination with advanced combustion control, aims to stabilize the flame efficiently and reduce the formation of nanoparticles and NOx emissions. The ICONIC combustion concept is an end-to-end process that involves the burning of an iron aerosol mixture, collection of iron-oxide powder, and regeneration of iron powder using green hydrogen, hence ensuring a closed-loop energy cycle.

The proposed development includes a small-scale system development phase followed by a conceptual design for a Mega-Watt size implementation. The project outcomes are expected to yield a well-controllable ICONIC burner that can be scaled up for industrial applications. The proposal details the potential for wide-reaching impacts, including industrial-scale system implementation and a thorough market evaluation. The involvement of start-ups and interest from potential launching customers indicate strong commercial prospects. The project is aligned with the ERC's MetalFuel program and aims to achieve a successful Proof of Concept (PoC) as a key indicator of success.

A patent is pending for the ICONIC combustion concept, highlighting the project's innovation and its commitment to intellectual property protection. The proposed project promises to deliver a transformative solution for storing and transporting sustainable energy, contributing significantly to a cleaner and more sustainable future.

Abstract:

The "Stable and Clean Iron Power from ICONIC" project presents a revolutionary advancement in sustainable energy technology through the development of Iron Power – a CO2-free, circular energy carrier with high energy density, safety, and cost-effectiveness. Addressing current challenges associated with iron-based energy carriers such as flame stabilization, iron evaporation, and high NOx emissions, the ICONIC project proposes a novel combustion concept that leverages the recirculation of partly-cooled hot burnt gases, autoignition of iron aerosol mixtures, and suppression techniques to mitigate nanoparticle formation and reduce NOx emissions.

The ICONIC project will undergo a multi-phase development process, beginning with a small-scale system and progressing to a conceptual Mega-Watt size design. The technology focuses on the combustion of an iron aerosol mixture to generate heat for high-temperature processes, followed by the collection of the resultant iron-oxide powder. This powder will then be regenerated into iron powder using green hydrogen, completing the energy cycle without CO2 emissions. The project aims to produce a well-controllable ICONIC burner that epitomizes the practical application of this concept.

Anticipated results include a proof of concept for a stable and clean iron combustion system, industrial-scale implementation, and a thorough market evaluation. Commercial interest has already been registered from start-ups and potential launching customers, demonstrating the project's viability and potential for widespread adoption.

The project upholds the ERC MetalFuel program's objectives by developing a disruptive technology with substantial environmental benefits. With the successful development of the ICONIC combustion concept, this project promises to contribute significantly to the sustainable energy market, offering a viable solution for energy storage and transport while mitigating the environmental impact of current energy systems.
